meanings.sent1: I like to keek at the presents under the tree.
meanings.sent2: She will keek through the window to see who is outside.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat would keek at the mouse scurrying by.
meanings.sent4: The sun would keek through the clouds after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The child would keek around the corner to see if the coast was clear.

meanings.sent1: He took a keek at the map to find his way.
meanings.sent2: She gave a keek at the menu before deciding what to order.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gave a quick keek at the acorns before scampering away.
meanings.sent4: The keek of the camera captured the fleeting moment perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The keek of the telescope revealed a distant star in the night sky.
